content.title: Stipend To Students Studying At Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur
content.department: Department of Higher Education, Government of Nagaland
content.beneficiary: Students studying at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur
content.details: The Stipend to Students studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur is a scheme implemented by the Government of Nagaland to provide financial assistance to students studying at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur. The scheme was initiated in the year 2015-16. Under this scheme, the state government provides a monthly stipend of Rs. 400 to 150 students studying at the institute. The stipend is disbursed from the allocated fund under the scholarship by the state government. The primary objective of the scheme is to encourage education and provide financial support to the economically weaker sections of the society to pursue higher education in Hindi language. The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to the students who may face financial constraints in continuing their education at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur. The stipend helps the students cover their educational expenses and meet their daily needs. By providing financial support, the scheme encourages the students to pursue their studies and enhances their chances of employment in the future. The Stipend to Students studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur scheme promotes education and helps increase access to education for students from economically weaker sections.
benefits: Financial assistance: The scheme provides a stipend of Rs. 400 per month to 150 students studying at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur.
Encourages education: The scheme encourages students from economically weaker sections to pursue their studies.
Increases access to education: The stipend can help increase access to education for students who may not have the financial means.
Enhances employability: Students can acquire necessary skills and knowledge to enhance their employability.
eligibility: Students studying at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur.
documents_required: Aadhaar card or other proof of identity
Proof of income from the student's family
Mark sheets of the previous academic years
Admission letter or proof of admission to the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur
Bank account details of the student or the guardian to receive the stipend amount.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for the stipend under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Students studying at the Government Hindi Institute in Dimapur are eligible to receive the stipend under this scheme.

faqs.question: What is the amount of the stipend provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Amount Of The Stipend Provided Under This Scheme Is Rs. 400 Per Month.

faqs.question: How is the stipend amount disbursed?
faqs.answer: The stipend amount is disbursed to the bank account of the student or the guardian provided in the application form.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for the Stipend to Students studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur scheme in Nagaland?
faqs.answer: Students who are enrolled in a course at the Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur in Nagaland and are residents of Nagaland are eligible to apply for the stipend.

faqs.question: What is the age limit for the scheme?
faqs.answer: There is no age limit specified for the Stipend to Students studying at Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur scheme in Nagaland.

faqs.question: Is there any income limit for the applicants?
faqs.answer: There is no income limit specified for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is the scheme applicable only to students of a particular course or stream?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme is applicable only to students who are enrolled in a Hindi course at the Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur in Nagaland.

faqs.question: Are there any minimum marks required to be eligible for the scheme?
faqs.answer: There are no minimum marks required to be eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there any preference given to students belonging to a particular category?
faqs.answer: No, the scheme is open to all students who meet the eligibility criteria regardless of their category or caste.

faqs.question: Can students from other states apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only students who are residents of Nagaland are eligible for the scheme.

faqs.question: Can students who are enrolled in a distance learning or correspondence course at the Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only students who are enrolled in a regular course at the Govt. Hindi Institute Dimapur are eligible for the scheme.
